candidates.title: Instant and Duration subscriptions for `crux_time`
candidates.body:
Updates `crux_time` capability to be more closely aligned with [`wasi-clocks`](https://github.com/WebAssembly/wasi-clocks/).

- [x] update `now` to return an `Instant`, which represents a UTC point in time (number of seconds since the epoch and number of nanoseconds since the last second).
- [x] add `subscribe_duration` and its async counterpart. The shell side of the capability responds when the requested duration has elapsed.
- [x] add `subscribe_instant` and its async counterpart. The shell side of the capability responds when the requested instant has arrived.
- [x] Add a test that demonstrates a debounce based on `subscribe_duration`

- [x] update pnpm deps
- [x] update `dioxus` examples (`counter` and `simple_counter` to 0.5 with signals)

candidates.title: Update examples for latest `crux_http`
candidates.body:

- [x] expose `HttpErrorHttp` from `crux_http`
- [x] add `impl From<Result<HttpResponse, HttpError>> for HttpResult` to `crux_http`
- [x] update all variants of `counter` and `cat_facts` examples to use `HttpResult`
- [x] move `cli` and `tauri` examples from `surf` to `reqwest` (`surf` now requires silly conversions since we started using a fork of `http-types` in `crux_http`)
- [x] move from `async-std` to `tokio`

candidates.title: Release crux_http 0.7.1
candidates.body:
### Changes

- Fixes a type generation problem with the newly exposed `HttpResult` and `HttpError`
- **Requires explicit tracing of crux_http::HttpError when using typegen**

candidates.title: Update counter example to latest crux_core and crux_http.

This is work in progress for now, once we release #207 I'll bump to the newly rleased version of `crux_http` and merge

- [x] update to latest crux_http API
- [x] add missing type tracing  
- [x] use crates rather than local paths

candidates.title: Release crux_http 0.7.0
candidates.body:
New version of crux_http

## Breaking changes

- **The protocol between shell and core has changed. Core now expects a `HttpResult` rather than a `HttpResponse`**, see #204 for details

candidates.title: Better error handling for crux_http
candidates.body:
This should allow apps to handle HTTP errors better and provide special error handling for bad requests, unauthorized requests and other common situations that can be handled gracefully.

There are two changes
* A nicer error type which is easier to work with
* When using the event returning API, response status in the 4xx and 5xx range is considered an `Err` not an `Ok`

candidates.title: update examples to latest crux
candidates.body: This PR updates all the examples to work with the latest versions of crux crates. I also moved the crux dependencies to become workspace dependencies so that they are in sync and easy to point to local paths when testing.

candidates.title: `crux_http` to use form of `http-types`
candidates.body:
The published `http-types` crate uses 128bit `trace_id`, which doesn't compile for `wasm32-unknown-emscripten`.

See https://github.com/http-rs/http-types/pull/522

candidates.title: Allow bridge to use different serializer
candidates.body:
Addresses #191. The current state is pretty awful and not ready to ship, but the basic mechanics should work, I hope.

# to do
- [x] Proof of concept implementation
- [x] Test examples across platforms for backwards compatibility
- [x] Add a test with JSON serialization
- [x] Choose better names for things
- [x] Document, and add warnings about typegen not supporting other serialization than bincode (at least for now)

candidates.title: remove http_types default features from crux_http
candidates.body: The `crux_http` capability crate depended on the `http_types` feature `fs`, which does not compile for `wasm32-unknown-emscripten`. This PR removes that and the code that depended on it (which doesn't make sense inside a Crux core anyway).

candidates.title: Async KV and Time capability APIs
candidates.body:
Resolves #181 and #182.

Updates both KV and Time capbilities adding an async version of their API. I also switched the Time capability to use Chrono for the underlying representation - it supports timezones and serialization, so it was quite an easy choice. Open to suggestions for a better choice, if you think Chrono is too heavy a dependency for this. 

I also made `Render` capability `Clone` so it can be used along async composition (otherwise typical `Capabilities` can't be `Clone`).

candidates.title: Async capability combinators
candidates.body:
This PR is work in progress on #91.

It turns out, surprisingly, that async capability combinators were always possible in "user land", and could be implemented as an additional capability, but the implementation is not exactly obvious, and this type of use needs to be supported by the capabilities being orchestrated across, especially `crux_http`.

This PR aims to make the use of `async` across multiple capabilities more obvious. There are a few challenges to overcome

- [x] The Orchestrate capability should probably come with crux_core
- [ ] ~Automatically derive `Clone` for capabilities and the `Capabilities` struct, to avoid various lifetime errors when moving the capabilities or the context into the async blocks~  - decided against, it would conflict with custom `Clone` implementations
- [x] Provide a `Never` operation type
- [x] Avoid producing an `Effect` variant for capabilities who's ~operations are `Never` ()~ fields are `#[effect(skip)]`
- [x] The use needs thorough documentation and an example
- [ ] Existing capabilities need to expose an async version of their APIs (#180, #181, #182)

All feedback on the ergonomics of this is welcome at this stage, but I'd like to aim to ship this soon, ideally this week.

candidates.title: Deps
candidates.body:
- [x] update Rust dependencies
- [x] update pnpm dependencies

candidates.title: remove uuid unused wasm-bindgen feature flag
candidates.body:
`uuid` 1.7.0 has dropped the wasm-bindgen feature flag making it incompatible with previous versions (<= 1.6.1). 

The response from `uuid` maintainers:

> Thanks for pointing this out! The `wasm-bindgen` dependency was never meant to be public. It was only a Cargo limitation that made it so. Packages should instead use the js feature...

candidates.title: Local install of cargo-xcode@1.7.0
candidates.body:
Recent changes to `cargo-xcode` mean that we need to use version <=1.7.0 for now. We are investigating why this is (and also looking for alternatives).

In the meantime, installing `cargo-xcode` globally can be problematic (tools such as [`topgrade`](https://github.com/topgrade-rs/topgrade) will keep updating it). Fortunately, `cargo-run-bin` allows us to use an install of `cargo-xcode` that is local to our repo. I have updated the example `Cargo.toml` files to include the locked version, and updated the book documentation to describe how to set up `cargo-xcode` both globally and locally.

candidates.title: Leptos 0.5.0
candidates.body:
In Leptos 0.5.0, components no longer need context (`cx: Scope`), which simplifies our examples. This PR updates  our examples accordingly.

Also updates Yew to 0.21, Tauri to 1.5, `toml`, `thiserror`, and `insta` — all of which AFAICT have no breaking changes.

candidates.title: iOS examples — extract core wrapper
candidates.body: This updates all 6 iOS examples to extract a "core" wrapper (the generic code that only changes when new capabilities are used) and to be more consistent with each other.

candidates.title: Refactor examples
candidates.body:
A bit of a large PR, sorry. This is all around tidying up the examples ahead of Rust Global in Seattle. Covers all the web-based examples, iOS and Android to follow.

- [x] update `crux doctor` to take a `path` arg so that you can see diffs just for the specified directory
- [x] make `typegen` for `cores` in `Crux.toml` optional (caters for the situation where you have `shared` but not `shared_types` (like `hello_world`)
- [x] update the examples so that all the boilerplate code is in separate files (still to do in another PR — iOS, Android, Tauri)
- [x] make the platform sub-app in catfacts a little more self contained with ability to test at sub-app level

candidates.title: Split simple counter out of hello world example
candidates.body: This PR splits the current "hello world" example into "hello world" and "simple counter"

candidates.title: Add a tap to pay example app
candidates.body: Add a demo of a simple application with a multi-screen navigation behaviour.

candidates.title: Basic `crux doctor`
candidates.body:
Basic `crux doctor`command.

- [x] `Crux.toml` — Parse, validate, rewrite
- [x] List missing files (for which there is a template)
- [x] Show diffs between existing files and their rendered templates
- [x] Add embryonic templates for cores and shells

contributes to #126 

```bash
Usage: crux [OPTIONS] --template-dir <TEMPLATE_DIR> [COMMAND]

Commands:
  doctor  [aliases: doc]
  help    Print this message or the help of the given subcommand(s)

Options:
  -t, --template-dir <TEMPLATE_DIR>  temporary
  -v, --verbose...
  -i, --include-source-code
  -h, --help                         Print help
  -V, --version                      Print version
```

e.g, this gives the all clear...

```bash
cd examples/simple_counter
crux -t ../../templates/simple_counter doctor
```

... but this would show up some diffs
```bash
cd examples/hello_world
crux -t ../../templates/simple_counter doctor
```

We need to work out what the templates should be and how they are distributed, but this is very much a super-minimal start

- [x] Re-creates all the NextJS examples, removing the use of the wasm-pack plugin (no need for it as we can now just add the `shared` and `shared_types` as packages with `pnpm`).

candidates.title: Add response headers to HTTP Capability protocol
candidates.body:
Adds ability to use HTTP headers returned from requests. 

- [x] Add headers to `HttpResponse`
- [x] Add builder pattern to avoid having to add `..Default::default()` everywhere

candidates.title: fix cat facts example
candidates.body:
- [x] add a GET route to the Counter example server (https://crux-counter.fly.dev/cat) to replace the probably defunct API we were using. Returns a URL for a cat image randomly from a list of 25
- [x] tidy up examples

candidates.title: Update dependencies and associated code
candidates.body:
This PR updates dependencies, some of which required code cahnges:
- [x] `uniffi` from `0.23` to `0.24.1` — this is a significant update (and we can probably take advantage of some [new features](https://github.com/mozilla/uniffi-rs/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md)). I updated and tested the Android and iOS apps and the NextJS web app.
- [x] `leptos` from  `0.3.1` to `0.4.0` — also a significant update. I adjusted the Leptos examples accordingly.

Note: I haven't updated `automerge` from `0.4.1` to `0.5.0` — this is much trickier. The [breaking changes](https://github.com/automerge/automerge/blob/main/rust/CHANGELOG.md) may be useful, require some refactoring.

candidates.title: Counter example in leptos
candidates.body: I was interested to see how Crux works with UI frameworks that are based on fine-grained reactivity. This is a basic example implemented in [Leptos](https://github.com/leptos-rs/leptos) that we can evolve/work with.

candidates.title: implement derive macro for Capability trait
candidates.body: Adds a derive macro for the `Capability` trait to the `crux_macros` crate, updates usages and docs

candidates.title: use bincode instead of bcs
candidates.body:
Use [bincode](https://github.com/bincode-org/bincode) instead of [bcs](https://github.com/zefchain/bcs).

It seems to us that bincode is faster, more widely used, better maintained, supported by `serde_generate`, supports `f32` & `f64`, and probably a safer bet for now.

- [x] use the installer from `serde_generate` to output the serialization and deserialization code for Swift and Kotlin
- [x] wrap `SharedTypes` (including `serde` and `bincode`) in a Swift package for easier use on iOS
- [x] update all examples
- [x] update docs
- [x] remove redundant serialization dependencies from capability crates

candidates.title: Add autodiscovery for type generation
candidates.body:
It is possible for us to find all the types used by a Crux app by starting with the top-level type implementing the `App` trait and registering the `Event`, `ViewModel` and all the capability operations and their outputs. That is the total set of types which we will be sending across the FFI boundary (including all the types used within those types).

In this way we can avoid listing all the types manually and reduce the build.rs of the `shared_type` crates to a single line (and eventually hopefully remove it altogether).

# To do
- [x] Basic scanning of the App type
- [x] Macro generated walking of the Capabilities struct
- [x] Bridge machinery types (Request, EffectFfi, etc.)
- [x] Use in all examples

candidates.title: Add a typegen interface for registering a type with samples
candidates.body:
Adds a function that exposes a slightly lower-level interface than the existing `register_type()`. Fixes #102 

Before merge:

- [ ] remove `SendUuid` from the Counter app. I left that in for now as a sort of integration test, but we should remove it before merging.

candidates.title: Add tauri version of examples/counter app
candidates.body:
This is a working version of the `counter` example app, using [Tauri 2.0.0 alpha](https://next--tauri.netlify.app/next/api/config/) with React. I'm opening this PR mainly to show that this combination works, and seems as clean as any of the other examples. This is all possible because of @charypar 's recent changes in #87. I'm not sure if we want to add this example to the repo. I realize that every example is a maintenance commitment, and we can't include everything.

Anyway, some notes:

- much of the code is lifted from other `counter` examples (e.g. cli), so it should be pretty familiar
- the UI is vanilla React, but the React component is copied from `examples/web-nextjs`
- so far I've only built this in the desktop dev environment
    - I haven't packaged the app yet
    - I've tried building iOS unsuccessfully. Tauri mobile is still in alpha, and it's pretty unstable at the moment. I just haven't had time to slog through the errors. This should be easy to update once the Tauri dependency settles down.

## Getting started

```
cd examples/counter
cargo build --package shared
cargo build --package shared_types
cd tauri
pnpm install
pnpm tauri dev
```

Edit: Corrected the `pnpm tauri dev` command that was causing an error with the missing `dist` folder

chosen_pr.title: chore: release
chosen_pr.body:
## 🤖 New release * `crux_core`: 0.7.1 -> 0.7.2 (✓ API compatible changes) * `crux_http`: 0.4.5 -> 0.4.6 (✓ API compatible changes) * `crux_macros`: 0.3.5 -> 0.3.6 * `crux_time`: 0.1.8 -> 0.2.0 (⚠️ API breaking changes) * `doctest_support`: 0.1.0 * `crux_kv`: 0.1.7 -> 0.1.8 (✓ API compatible changes) ### ⚠️ `crux_time` breaking changes ``` --- failure inherent_method_missing: pub method removed or renamed --- Description: A publicly-visible method or associated fn is no longer available under its prior name. It may have been renamed or removed entirely. ref: https://doc.rust-lang.org/cargo/reference/semver.html#item-remove impl: https://github.com/obi1kenobi/cargo-semver-checks/tree/v0.27.0/src/lints/inherent_method_missing.ron Failed in: Time::get, previously in file /private/var/folders/vj/_19mcln57qz5j75lqqjtxc540000gn/T/.tmp5TlO0a/crux_time/src/lib.rs:39 --- failure struct_missing: pub struct removed or renamed --- Description: A publicly-visible struct cannot be imported by its prior path. A `pub use` may have been removed, or the struct itself may have been renamed or removed entirely. ref: https://doc.rust-lang.org/cargo/reference/semver.html#item-remove impl: https://github.com/obi1kenobi/cargo-semver-checks/tree/v0.27.0/src/lints/struct_missing.ron Failed in: struct crux_time::TimeResponse, previously in file /private/var/folders/vj/_19mcln57qz5j75lqqjtxc540000gn/T/.tmp5TlO0a/crux_time/src/lib.rs:17 ```
Changelog

## `crux_core`

## [0.7.2](https://github.com/redbadger/crux/compare/crux_core-v0.7.1...crux_core-v0.7.2) - 2024-01-26 ### Fixed - fix clippy lints ### Other - Capabilities don't need to be clone - Clone less, to lead by example - Make render capability Clone to suport composition - Test Compose::spawn example using local doctest support crate - unimplemented rather than todo - docs for effect macro - effect derive macro allows skipping variants (e.g. for Never operations) - More straightforward version of clone - Introduce a new core capability which allows ad-hoc composition of other capabilities - introduce `Never` type for capabilities that don't request effects - tidy format strings - Add integration test that exposes async capability APIs to an orchestrator capability - update Rust deps - remove uuid unused wasm-bindgen feature flag
## `crux_http`
## [0.4.6](https://github.com/redbadger/crux/compare/crux_http-v0.4.5...crux_http-v0.4.6) - 2024-01-26 ### Fixed - fix clippy lints ### Other - Capabilities don't need to be clone - Clone less, to lead by example - Prefer IntoFuture as the main RequestBuilder async API - Doc comment - Remove irrelevant comment - Add async API to crux_http - update Rust deps
## `crux_macros`
## [0.3.6](https://github.com/redbadger/crux/compare/crux_macros-v0.3.5...crux_macros-v0.3.6) - 2024-01-26 ### Other - darling default - unimplemented rather than todo - docs for effect macro - effect derive macro allows skipping variants (e.g. for Never operations) - update Rust deps
## `crux_time`
## [0.2.0](https://github.com/redbadger/crux/compare/crux_time-v0.1.8...crux_time-v0.2.0) - 2024-01-26 ### Other - Fix misleading comment - Capabilities don't need to be clone - Clone less, to lead by example - Add async API to crux_time, move to using chrono::DateTime as representation
## `doctest_support`
## [0.1.0](https://github.com/redbadger/crux/releases/tag/doctest_support-v0.1.0) - 2024-01-26 ### Other - Test Compose::spawn example using local doctest support crate
## `crux_kv`
## [0.1.8](https://github.com/redbadger/crux/compare/crux_kv-v0.1.7...crux_kv-v0.1.8) - 2024-01-26 ### Other - Capabilities don't need to be clone - Clone less, to lead by example - Add async API to crux_kv
